qas.question: What wing of the GOP was Eisenhower opposed to?
In what year were the first federal elections after Eisenhower became president?
Prior to the 1954 elections, who had majorities in Congress?
What type of Republican did Eisenhower characterize himself as?

context: As the <a1_0>1954<a1_0/> congressional elections approached, and it became evident that the <a2_0>Republicans<a2_0/> were in danger of losing their thin majority in both houses, Eisenhower was among those blaming the Old Guard for the losses, and took up the charge to stop suspected efforts by the right wing to take control of the GOP. Eisenhower then articulated his position as a <a3_0>moderate, progressive<a3_0/> Republican: "I have just one purpose ... and that is to build up a strong progressive Republican Party in this country. If the <a0_0>right<a0_0/> wing wants a fight, they are going to get it ... before I end up, either this Republican Party will reflect progressivism or I won't be with them anymore."
